channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For Alaskan Evacuees, Home Is Gone, With No Return in Sight
item.description: Their communities devastated from last weekend’s storm, many are in shelters in Anchorage and facing life in a completely different world.

item.title: China says the U.S. used dozens of ‘special cyberattack weapons’ on the country’s time-keeping system
item.description: The ministry's statement could fuel tensions between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: Amazon’s AWS Disruption Creates Outages for Hundreds of Websites for Hours
item.description: Amazon Web Services, a major provider of cloud services, said most of its clients were back online. Hulu, Snapchat, Venmo and the British government w...

item.title: ‘We would buy some beef from Argentina’: Trump’s plan to counter the flesh-eating parasite keeping red meat prices skyhigh
item.description: U.S. beef prices have been stubbornly high for a variety of reasons.

item.title: Wall Street might be panicking over private credit but insiders can’t see what all the fuss is about
item.description: Some say this is more about mudslinging between private credit’s competitors and a misunderstanding about direct lending.

item.title: Scott Galloway says don’t aspire to be a billionaire because ‘it’s not going to get you anything’—here’s what to do with money instead of hoarding it
item.description: Galloway's advice aligns with research from Nobel Prize-winning economist Daniel Kahneman, who examined the relationship between income and happiness.

item.title: Senator Ruben Gallego Has Three Words for Democrats
item.description: Lessons from a Democrat who won in a Republican state.

item.title: Peanut Allergies Have Plummeted in Children, Study Shows
item.description: Doctors have long recommended that infants avoid peanuts. But in 2017, experts officially reversed that guidance, and food allergies decreased sharply...

item.title: Billionaire Bill Ackman says he doesn’t like ‘wasting money’—he’ll even drive elsewhere for cheaper garages, despite once owning a parking company
item.description: Pershing Square Capital founder Bill Ackman, worth $8.4 billion, turns off every light and gets upset at wasting money on the little things. Warren Bu...

item.title: Prison Guard Convicted in Fatal Beating Caught on Video, With 2 Acquitted
item.description: Footage of a group of guards punching, choking and stomping Robert L. Brooks ignited an outcry. Six guards pleaded guilty to charges.

item.title: Louvre Museum Remains Closed After Jewelry Robbery: What to Know
item.description: A stunning heist has raised uncomfortable questions about security at the famed Paris museum.

item.title: Rodrigo Paz Wins Bolivia’s Presidential Election
item.description: Mr. Paz won the presidential election after promising gradual economic reforms, though many voters seemed more drawn to his divisive running mate.

item.description: Amazon Web Services, a major provider of cloud services, said most of its clients were back online. Hulu, Snapchat, Venmo and the British government w...

item.title: Rodrigo Paz Wins Bolivia’s Presidential Runoff
item.description: Rodrigo Paz, a right-leaning centrist candidate who had emerged as a surprise front-runner in Bolivia’s presidential election, defeated his conservati...

item.title: Louvre Remains Closed Day After Brazen Jewel Heist
item.description: The Louvre museum in Paris remained closed on Monday after thieves stole priceless jewels in a brazen heist that lasted seven minutes and shocked the ...
